title: Container With Most Water
prompt:
Given an array of positive integers height, where each integer represents the height of a vertical line, find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container that holds the most water.

Return the maximum area.

Area formula:
area = min(height[i], height[j]) * (j - i)

If the array has fewer than 2 lines, return 0.
constraintQuestions: Are all heights positive integers (no zero/negative)?
Can the input be empty or have one value?
Should we return 0 when no container can be formed?
Do we care about the thickness of the lines? (assume no)

walkthrough.title: Brute force idea
walkthrough.body:
This is a maximum-value question.
Check every pair (i, j), compute:
area = min(height[i], height[j]) * (j - i)
Track maxArea.
Time: O(n^2), Space: O(1).

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (brute force implementation)
Optimized two-pointer insight
walkthrough.body:
Start with the widest container: left = 0, right = n-1.
Current area uses the shorter of the two heights.
Moving the taller pointer cannot increase the limiting height, but moving the shorter pointer might.
So:
- compute area
- update best
- move the pointer with the smaller height inward
Time: O(n), Space: O(1).
